sen.j: 仲国造（なかのくにのみやつこ・なかこくぞう)は常陸国東部を支配した国造。
sen.e: Nakanokuninomiyatsuko 仲国造 (also known as Nakakokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko ruled the east part of Hitachi Province.
Naka no kuninomiyatsuko 仲国造 (also known as Nakakokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) ruled the east part of Hitachi Province.
sen.cmt: 表記変更local ruling families in ancient Japan を追加しました。
sen.e: Naka no kuninomiyatsuko 仲国造 (also known as Nakakokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) ruled the east part of Hitachi Province.

sen.j: 那珂国造・那賀国造・常道仲国造とも。
sen.e: It was also written as 那珂国造, 那賀国造, and 常道仲国造.
It was also written as 那珂国造, 那賀国造, and 常道仲国造.

Kamuyaimimi no mikoto.

sen.j: その後裔の建借間命が成務天皇朝に仲国造に任じられたという。
sen.e: It is said that the descendant Takekashimamikoto was appointed Nakanokuninomiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.
It is said that the descendant Takekashima no mikoto was appointed Naka no kuninomiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.

sen.j: 現在の茨城県那珂湊市・勝田市など。
sen.e: Present Nakaminato City, Katsuta City and the like in Ibaraki Prefecture.

sen.j: 大建壬生夫子 ...... 古墳時代の伝説上の人。
sen.e: Oodate Mibunoonoko: A legendary person during the Kofun period.
